positions.comment: Squalls thru the night but appreciated the added wind. Calm seas. Great sailing.
Quickly getting into and enjoying passage making rhythms. Dorado for dinner.
Perfect sailing blessed with fair winds and calm seas.
Dreams come true. CaVa anchored in Tahanea atoll in Tuamotus of Fr. Polynesia.
Left Tahanea for Moorea. Messy seas. Lots of wind. Skiipjack tuna for dinner..
Lumpy, bumpy seas. An uncomfortable but fast ride. Anxious to get there
Arrived Moorea 20:00 UTC and is anchored in Cook (or Paopao) Bay
CaVa anchored in Papeete, Tahiti at 22:00 UTC to clear in/out and reprovision
CaVa anchored in Avae Baie of Ile Huahine, French Polynesia at 22:00 UTC 8/6/05.
CaVa near Toahotu Pass on Ile Tahaa of Society Islands, Fr. Polynesia.
CaVa anchored off Ilot Motuea on the West side of Ile Tahaa.
CaVa arrived  Bora Bora today from Raiatea and anchored off of Topua Iti
CaVa departed Bora Bora early this PM bound for Suarrow. Clouds and drizzle.
Rain/squalls past 24 hours with 25 to 30 kts wind overnight and 8 to 10 foor seas.
Continued rain and squalls throughout day, winds and seas down some this PM
Squalls all night and this AM. 170 NM to Suwarrow dead down wind with seas.
CaVa arrived Suwarrow (Suvorov) atoll in the Northern Cooks Islands.
After setting a record for longest stay this year, we sadly left Suwarrow atoll.
Light winds and flat seas. Pleasant conditions but slow going. 400 NM to Niue.
Filled fridge w/ 54 in. wahoo. Passed s/v Drifter Way after 20 hr head start.
Light wind, pleasant sail. 105 n miles to Niue.
CaVa in Niue and on a mooring. One of the more comfortable passages to date.
CaVa ileft Niue this AM headed for the Haa'pai group of Tonga with 206 NM to go
Expect to shorten sails to slow down for tomorrow AM arrival in Haa'pai group
Anchored at Lape I in Tonga's Vava'u group. Bypassed Ha'apia due to weather.
